verses.verse: Then the Lord<WH3068> sent<WH7971> Nathan<WH5416> to David.<WH1732> And he came<WH935> to him, and said,<WH559> "There were two<WH8147> men<WH376> in one<WH259> city,<WH5892> the one<WH259> rich<WH6223> and the other<WH259> poor.<WH7326>
"The rich<WH6223> man<WH6223> had<WH1961> a great<WH3966> many<WH7235> flocks<WH6629> and herds.<WH1241>

"But the poor<WH7326> man had nothing<WH369> <WH3605> except<WH3588> <WH518> one<WH259> little<WH6996> ewe<WH3535> lamb<WH3535> Which<WH834> he bought<WH7069> and nourished;<WH2421> And it grew<WH1431> up together<WH9191> with him and his children.<WH1121> It would eat<WH398> of his bread<WH6595> and drink<WH8354> of his cup<WH3563> and lie<WH7901> in his bosom,<WH2436> And was like a daughter<WH1323> to him.

"Now a traveler<WH1982> came<WH935> to the rich<WH6223> man,<WH376> And he was unwilling<WH2550> to take<WH3947> from his own flock<WH6629> or his own herd,<WH1241> To prepare<WH6213> for the wayfarer<WH732> who had come<WH935> to him; Rather he took<WH3947> the poor<WH7326> man<WH376>'s ewe<WH3535> lamb<WH3535> and prepared<WH6213> it for the man who had come<WH935> to him."

Then David's anger<WH639> burned<WH2734> greatly<WH3966> against the man,<WH376> and he said<WH559> to Nathan,<WH5416> "As the Lord<WH3068> lives,<WH2416> surely<WH3588> the man<WH376> who has done<WH6213> this<WH2088> deserves<WH1121> to die.<WH4194>
"And he must make<WH9608> restitution<WH9608> for the lamb<WH3535> fourfold,<WH706> because<WH6118> <WH834> he did<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> and had<WH2550> no<WH3808> compassion.<WH2550>"

Nathan<WH5416> then said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are the man!<WH376> Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel,<WH3478> 'It is I who anointed<WH4886> you king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel<WH3478> and it is I who delivered<WH4672> you from the hand<WH3027> of Saul.<WH7586>

'I also gave<WH5414> you your master's house<WH1004> and your master's wives<WH802> into your care,<WH2436> and I gave<WH5414> you the house<WH1004> of Israel<WH3478> and Judah;<WH3063> and if<WH518> [that had been] too little,<WH4592> I would have added<WH3254> to you many more things like these!<WH2007>

'Why<WH4069> have you despised<WH959> the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> by doing<WH6213> evil<WH7451> in His sight<WH5869>? You have struck<WH5221> down<WH5221> Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> with the sword,<WH2719> have taken<WH3947> his wife<WH802> to be your wife,<WH802> and have killed<WH2026> him with the sword<WH2719> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983>

'Now<WH6258> therefore, the sword<WH2719> shall never<WH3808> <WH5704> <WH5769> depart<WH5493> from your house,<WH1004> because<WH6118> <WH3588> you have despised<WH959> Me and have taken<WH3947> the wife<WH802> of Uriah<WH223> the Hittite<WH2850> to be your wife.<WH802>'

"Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord,<WH3068> 'Behold,<WH2009> I will raise<WH6965> up evil<WH9567> against<WH5921> you from your own household;<WH1004> I will even take<WH3947> your wives<WH802> before your eyes,<WH5869> and give<WH5414> [them] to your companion,<WH7453> and he shall lie<WH7901> with your wives<WH802> in broad<WH5869> daylight.<WH8121> <WH2088>
'Indeed<WH3588> you did<WH6213> it secretly,<WH5643> but I will do<WH6213> this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> before<WH5048> all<WH3605> Israel,<WH3478> and under<WH5048> the sun.<WH8121>' "

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Nathan,<WH5416> "I have sinned<WH2398> against the Lord.<WH3068>" And Nathan<WH5416> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "The Lord<WH3068> also<WH1571> has taken<WH5674> away<WH5674> your sin;<WH9128> you shall not die.<WH4191>

"However,<WH657> because<WH3588> by this<WH2088> deed<WH1697> you have given<WH5006> occasion to the enemies<WH340> of the Lord<WH3068> to blaspheme,<WH5006> the child<WH1121> also<WH1571> that is born<WH3209> to you shall surely<WH4191> die.<WH4191>"
So Nathan<WH5416> went<WH1980> to his house.<WH1004> Then the Lord<WH3068> struck<WH5062> the child<WH3206> that Uriah's widow<WH802> bore<WH3205> to David,<WH1732> so that he was [very] sick.<WH605>
David<WH1732> therefore inquired<WH1245> of God<WH430> for the child;<WH5288> and David<WH1732> fasted<WH6684> <WH6685> and went<WH935> and lay<WH7901> all night<WH3885> on the ground.<WH776>

And the elders<WH2205> of his household<WH1004> stood<WH6965> beside<WH5921> him in order to raise<WH6965> him up from the ground,<WH776> but he was unwilling<WH3808> <WH14> and would not eat<WH1262> food<WH3899> with them.

Then it happened<WH1961> on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> that the child<WH3206> died.<WH4191> And the servants<WH5650> of David<WH1732> were afraid<WH3372> to tell<WH5046> him that the child<WH3206> was dead,<WH4191> for they said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH2009> while the child<WH3206> was [still] alive,<WH2416> we spoke<WH1696> to him and he did not listen<WH8085> to our voice.<WH6963> How<WH349> then can we tell<WH559> him that the child<WH3206> is dead,<WH4191> since he might do<WH6213> [himself] harm!<WH9567>"

But when David<WH1732> saw<WH7200> that his servants<WH5650> were whispering<WH3907> together, David<WH1732> perceived<WH995> that the child<WH3206> was dead;<WH4191> so David<WH1732> said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "Is the child<WH3206> dead<WH4191>?" And they said,<WH559> "He is dead.<WH4191>"

So David<WH1732> arose<WH6965> from the ground,<WH776> washed,<WH7364> anointed<WH5480> [himself,] and changed<WH2498> his clothes;<WH8071> and he came<WH935> into the house<WH1004> of the Lord<WH3068> and worshiped.<WH7812> Then he came<WH935> to his own house,<WH1004> and when he requested,<WH7592> they set<WH7760> food<WH3899> before him and he ate.<WH398>

Then his servants<WH5650> said<WH559> to him, "What<WH4100> is this<WH2088> thing<WH1697> that you have done<WH6213>? While<WH5668> the child<WH3206> was alive,<WH2416> you fasted<WH6684> and wept;<WH1058> but when<WH9201> the child<WH3206> died,<WH4191> you arose<WH6965> and ate<WH398> food.<WH3899>"

And he said,<WH559> "While the child<WH3206> was [still] alive,<WH2416> I fasted<WH6684> and wept;<WH1058> for I said,<WH559> 'Who<WH4310> knows,<WH3045> the Lord<WH3068> may be gracious<WH2603> to me, that the child<WH3206> may live.<WH2416>'
"But now<WH6258> he has died;<WH4191> why<WH4100> should I fast<WH6684>? Can<WH3201> I bring<WH7725> him back<WH7725> again<WH5750>? I shall go<WH1980> to him, but he will not return<WH7725> to me."

Then David<WH1732> comforted<WH5162> his wife<WH802> Bathsheba,<WH1339> and went<WH935> in to her and lay<WH7901> with her; and she gave<WH3205> birth<WH3205> to a son,<WH1121> and he named<WH7121> <WH8034> him Solomon.<WH8010> Now the Lord<WH3068> loved<WH157> him
and sent<WH7971> [word] through<WH3027> Nathan<WH5416> the prophet,<WH5030> and he named<WH7121> <WH8034> him Jedidiah<WH3041> for the Lord's sake.<WH5668>
Now Joab<WH3097> fought<WH3898> against Rabbah<WH7237> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon,<WH5983> and captured<WH3920> the royal<WH4410> city.<WH5892>

And Joab<WH3097> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David<WH1732> and said,<WH559> "I have fought<WH3898> against Rabbah,<WH7237> I have even<WH1571> captured<WH3920> the city<WH5892> of waters.<WH4325>

"Now<WH6258> therefore, gather<WH622> the rest<WH3499> of the people<WH5971> together and camp<WH2583> against<WH5921> the city<WH5892> and capture<WH3920> it, lest<WH6435> I capture<WH3920> the city<WH5892> myself<WH589> and it be named<WH7121> <WH8034> after<WH5921> me."
So David<WH1732> gathered<WH622> all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> and went<WH1980> to Rabbah,<WH7237> fought<WH3898> against it, and captured<WH3920> it.

Then he took<WH3947> the crown<WH5850> of their king<WH4428> from his head;<WH7218> and its weight<WH4948> [was] a talent<WH3603> of gold,<WH2091> and [in it was] a precious<WH3368> stone;<WH68> and it was [placed] on David's head.<WH7218> And he brought<WH3318> out the spoil<WH7998> of the city<WH5892> in great<WH3966> amounts.<WH7235>

He also brought<WH3318> out the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were in it, and set<WH7760> [them] under saws,<WH4050> sharp<WH2757> iron<WH1270> instruments,<WH2757> and iron<WH1270> axes,<WH4037> and made them pass<WH5674> through the brickkiln.<WH4404> And thus<WH3651> he did<WH6213> to all<WH3605> the cities<WH5892> of the sons<WH1121> of Ammon.<WH5983> Then David<WH1732> and all<WH3605> the people<WH5971> returned<WH7725> [to] Jerusalem.<WH3389>
